'''Vullaby''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バルチャイ''' ''Valchai'') is a dual-type {{2t|Dark|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Mandibuzz}} starting at [[level]] 54.

==Biology==
Vullaby resembles a baby vulture. It has a plump, stout body covered in dark gray feathers, tiny wings with gray tips, and pink feet with three clawed toes. Its neck is short and supports a round, pink head devoid of any feathers, except for a crest on the top. There is a collar of fluffy, light gray feathers around its neck. It seems to be wearing a broken skull as a diaper-like undergarment, hence its species name. Vullaby either finds this bone itself or uses one found for it by {{p|Mandibuzz}}. Vullaby is known to chase after weaker creatures. Vullaby is a female-only species.

==In the anime==
===Major appearances===
[[File:Vullaby anime.png|thumb|left|220px|Vullaby in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
Vullaby debuted in ''[[BW095|Unrest at the Nursery!]]'', where she was a Pokémon in the daycare belonging to {{OBP|Layla|BW095}} and usually got into a fight with {{p|Rufflet}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Vullaby appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]''.

Two Vullaby appeared in ''[[SM015|Rocking Clawmark Hill!]]'', as some of the Pokémon training up on [[Clawmark Hill]].

===Pokédex entries===
{{Animedexheader|Unova}}
{{Animedexbody|BW095|Vullaby|Ash's Pokédex|Vullaby, the Diapered Pokémon. Vullaby's small wings keep it from flying. It tends to chase Pokémon weaker than itself.}}
{{Animedexfooter/Pokémon|''Best Wishes''|Unova}}

==In the manga==
[[File:White Barbara.png|thumb|200px|Vullaby in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Vullaby appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where she was one of the Pokémon kidnapped by Team Plasma. She was later found in a stronghold and returned to her trainer.

{{adv|White}} catches a Vullaby who she nicknames Barbara. White casts Barbara for her villainous roles. She first appeared in ''[[PS500|With a Little Help from My Friends]]''.

Multiple Vullaby appeared in ''[[PS501|A Lost Melody]]''.

==Trivia==
* Vullaby and its {{p|Mandibuzz|evolution}} were created by [[James Turner]].<ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20130115083652/http://www.gamefreak.co.jp/blog/staff/?p=204 Game Freak staff blog]</ref>

===Origin===
Vullaby is based on a {{wp|vulture}} chick.

According to interviews with [[Ken Sugimori]] in ''Nintendo Dream'', Vullaby and Mandibuzz were added late into the development of {{v2|Black and White|s}}.

====Name origin====
Vullaby may be a combination of ''vulture'' and ''{{wp|lullaby}}'' (which are often sung to children) or ''baby''.

Valchai may be a combination of ''vulture'' and ''child''.
